alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 12 at 2:53AM PST until February 14 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph over high exposed terrain. * WHERE...Southern Oregon Cascades. This includes portions of Highway 140, Highway 66 and Dead Indian Memorial Highway. This also includes Lake of the Woods, Howard Prairie and surrounding areas. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult and impact the morning or evening commute. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility over high exposed terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Most of the snow will fall Monday afternoon into Tuesday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades
